title: Reuters Sports Schedule at 0600 GMT on Tuesday
text: February 19, 2018 / 3:28 PM / Updated 25 minutes ago Reuters Sports Schedule at 0600 GMT on Tuesday Reuters Staff Reuters sports schedule at 0600 GMT on Tuesday: WINTER OLYMPICS PYEONGCHANG, South Korea - The power and grace of the ice dance free dance takes centre stage on day 11 of the Games. Elsewhere, there are medals available in short track, biathlon, freestyle skiing halfpipe and in the nordic combined event. (OLYMPICS-2018/ PIX, TV, expect throughout) SOCCER Champions League, last 16, first leg (1945) Chelsea v Barcelona Bayern Munich v Besiktas Chelsea host Barca in mouthwatering last 16 showdown LONDON - Chelsea welcome Barcelona in a Champions League last 16 first leg match trying to take comfort from the fact that Lionel Messi has never scored in eight matches against them. (SOCCER-CHAMPIONS-CHE-FCB/(PIX, TV), expect by 2145 GMT/4:45 PM ET, by Martyn Herman and Clare Lovell, 400 words) Bayern face visiting Besiktas in last 16 clash MUNICH - Runaway Bundesliga leaders Bayern Munich are overwhelming favourites as they entertain Turkish side Besiktas in a Champions League last 16 first leg tie. (SOCCER-CHAMPIONS-BAY-BES/(PIX, TV), expect after 1400 GMT/8 AM ET, 300 words) United, Sevilla hold news conferences ahead of last 16 clash Manchester United and Sevilla hold news conferences ahead of their Champions League last 16, first leg in Seville on Wednesday. (SOCCER-CHAMPIONS-SEV-MUN/PREVIEW (PIX), 400 words) Shakhtar, Roma hold news conferences ahead of last 16 clash Shakhtar Donetsk and Roma hold news conferences ahead of their Champions League last 16, first leg game in Kharkiv on Wednesday. (SOCCER-CHAMPIONS-SHK-ROM/PREVIEW (PIX), 400 words) Asian Champions League HONG KONG - Chinese Super League side Shanghai SIPG take on Melbourne Victory looking for a second win in a row in the Asian Champions League while two-time winners Jeonbuk Motors from South Korea face Hong Kong’s Kitchee on Matchday Two of the continental championship. (SOCCER-ASIA/, expect by 1600 GMT/1100 AM ET, 500 words) MOTOR RACING Sauber Formula One car launch LONDON - The Swiss-based Sauber team, now with Alfa Romeo as title sponsor, present their new C37 Formula One car. Monaco’s Charles Leclerc, last year’s F2 champion, will make his F1 race debut with the team this season alongside experienced Swede Marcus Ericsson. (MOTOR-F1-SAUBER/, by Alan Baldwin, 400 words) Renault Formula One car launch LONDON - Renault unveil their 2018 Formula One car, with drivers Nico Hulkenberg and Carlos Sainz. (MOTOR-F1-RENAULT/ (TV), by Alan Baldwin, 400 words) RUGBY Six Nations Wales name team for Ireland match Wales name their side to face Ireland in Dublin on Saturday in the Six Nations followed by a news conference with coach Warren Gatland. (RUGBY-UNION-NATIONS-WAL/, 400 words) Asia desk editor: Greg Stutchbury
